channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rats eating remains of a dead animal., 20th December
item.description:
As above, plus the mush from leaves and mud make this part of the road treacherous. The rats were so engrossed in eating that they weren't even bothered by my dog. He went right up to them before they moved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stembridge Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poisonous, 20th December
item.description:
We have been told that the fruit from this tree (A female Ginkgo biloba, or Maidenhair Tree) out side no 23 is poisonous to dogs. The male of the species is harmless but the smelly fruit that drops from this female one is the problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jenton Avenue, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling bins overflowing again., 20th December
item.description:
Recycling area a constant eye-sore. Advice from council is being ignored or not understood. No one is flattening their cardboard boxes & polystyrene is put in the recycling with the cardboard. Also no one is flattening their large empty water containe

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Penshurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household items dumped, 20th December
item.description:
There are several items dumped next to the front wall of the house number 133 including mattresses, bed frame, chairs, etc This was dumped there a few days ago and is taking up a fair bit of the sidewalk

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 93 - 109, Knollys Road, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Leaves require clearing from gulleys, 20th December
item.description:
After Thursdayâ€™s wind and rain storm a long section of the gulley from the top bend of Summer Hill down towards the station bus stop has a large amount of leaves deposits. This was blocking the gulleys as the heavy rain tried to escape.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Summer Hill, Chislehurst, Greater London
